Ingredients.2: 1 (10 ounce) can refrigerated biscuit dough (such as Pillsbury Grands!®)

Ingredients.7: 1 salt and ground black pepper to taste

Ingredients.8: 0.5 cups cold water, or more as needed

Directions.1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.

Directions.2: Line the bottom of the prepared baking dish with biscuits.

Directions.3: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir sausage in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes; drain and discard grease. Scatter sausage over biscuit layer and top with 1 cup Cheddar cheese.

Directions.4: Whisk eggs, milk, salt, and pepper together in a bowl and pour over cheese layer.

Directions.5: Mix water and gravy mix together in a saucepan; bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until gravy is thickened, 1 to 2 minutes, adding more water for a thinner gravy. Pour gravy over egg layer. Sprinkle remaining 1/2 cup Cheddar cheese over casserole.

Directions.6: Bake in the preheated oven until eggs are fluffy and cheese is bubbling, about 30 minutes.
